feature: AI Audit AX Platform - AI Audit Project Implementation
workflow_rationale: This is a comprehensive multi-phase feature implementation that adds new capabilities across both frontend and backend services. It involves creating new UI components, state management stores, API endpoints, LangGraph nodes, and agent enhancements - all constituting new feature development rather than refactoring or bug fixes.

phases.name: Project Selection UI
phases.description: Create Project Store, Selector component, Registration Modal, and AppShell integration

subtasks.description: Create Project Store with Zustand for project state management
acceptance_criteria: Zustand store with fetchProjects(), selectProject(), createProject(), updateProject()
subtasks.notes: Created useProjectStore.ts with full CRUD operations, project selection, real-time Supabase subscriptions, persist middleware for localStorage, and comprehensive test suite. Committed as ae458a0. Note: Tests could not be run locally due to sandbox command restrictions (npm/npx/vitest blocked), but test file follows existing patterns from useTaskStore.test.ts.

subtasks.description: Create Project Selector dropdown component for chat header
subtasks.notes: Created ProjectSelector dropdown component at frontend/src/app/components/layout/ProjectSelector.tsx. Component includes: dropdown trigger with selected project display, project list with status badges (Planning/Execution/Review/Completed), loading/error/empty states, real-time subscription to project updates, and optional New Project button. Follows existing patterns from dropdown-menu.tsx and integrates with useProjectStore.

subtasks.description: Create Project Registration Modal with Zod validation
acceptance_criteria: Form fields: client_name, fiscal_year, overall_materiality, status
subtasks.notes: Created ProjectRegistrationModal.tsx with Zod validation schema for client_name (required string), fiscal_year (number, 2000-2100), overall_materiality (optional positive number), and status (enum). Integrated with react-hook-form using zodResolver. Modal integrates with useProjectStore for Supabase project creation, includes loading states, error handling, and auto-selects newly created project. Added zod and @hookform/resolvers dependencies to package.json. Committed as 4f22ceb.

subtasks.description: Integrate ProjectSelector into AppShell header
subtasks.notes: Integrated ProjectSelector into AppShell header with ProjectRegistrationModal. Added header bar with responsive layout, modal state management, and proper component composition.

phases.name: Real-time Agent Streaming
phases.description: Update useStreamingChat hook for real SSE and create Agent Conversation Panel

subtasks.description: Update useStreamingChat hook for real SSE connection with reconnection logic
subtasks.notes:
Updated useStreamingChat hook with real SSE connection support. Key features:
- Real SSE connection to /api/stream/{task_id} endpoint
- Exponential backoff reconnection (1s initial, 30s max, 10 max attempts)
- Event handling: message, heartbeat, artifact_start/update/complete, error, done
- Connection status tracking: disconnected, connecting, connected, error
- disconnect() method for manual termination
- Clean unmount with EventSource cleanup
- Backward-compatible mockMode option for demo/testing
- Comprehensive test suite with 47 test cases covering SSE mode, reconnection logic, and cleanup

Committed as 4d985b0. Tests cannot be run locally due to sandbox restrictions (npm commands blocked), but test file follows existing project patterns from useTaskStore.test.ts.

subtasks.description: Create Agent Conversation Panel for Partner/Manager/Staff agents
subtasks.notes:
Created AgentConversationPanel.tsx component at frontend/src/app/components/agents/AgentConversationPanel.tsx. Features implemented:
- Role indicators with visual distinction (Partner=purple, Manager=blue, Staff=green)
- Role filter tabs to filter messages by agent type (all/partner/manager/staff)
- Message type badges (instruction, response, tool-use, file-upload, human-feedback)
- Connection status indicator (connected/connecting/disconnected/error)
- Real-time streaming indicator with animated spinner
- Auto-scroll to latest message with manual scroll detection
- Timestamps with relative time display (e.g., "2 minutes ago")
- Attachment support with file links
- Unique agents display in header
- Compact mode option for smaller displays
- Empty state handling with appropriate messaging
Committed as 59a2d43. Component follows ChatInterface.tsx patterns and uses existing AgentMessage/AgentRole types.

phases.name: EGA and Task Hierarchy UI
phases.description: Create EGA Store, EGA List component, and Task Hierarchy Tree

subtasks.description: Create EGA Store with Zustand for EGA state management
acceptance_criteria: Integration with project store for project_id filtering
subtasks.notes: Created useEGAStore with Zustand following useTaskStore pattern. Added AuditEGA types to supabase.ts. Includes CRUD operations, real-time subscriptions, and getEGAsByProject helper. Tests created but could not be run due to command restrictions.

subtasks.description: Create EGA List component with risk badges and progress indicators
subtasks.notes: Created EGAList component with risk badges (Critical/High/Medium/Low with appropriate colors), progress indicators, filtering by risk level/status/search, summary cards, and integration with EGA and Project stores. Added route and tab for /workspace/egas.

subtasks.description: Create Task Hierarchy Tree component for 3-level (High→Mid→Low) display
subtasks.notes:
Created TaskHierarchyTree.tsx component at frontend/src/app/components/tasks/TaskHierarchyTree.tsx. Features implemented:
- 3-level hierarchy (High/EGA → Mid/Assertion → Low/Procedure) with visual distinction
- Expand/collapse functionality with React state management and Expand All/Collapse All buttons
- Status indicators with color-coded badges (Completed=green, In-Progress=blue, Review-Required=amber, Failed=red, Pending=gray)
- Level indicators with icons (FolderTree=High, FileText=Mid, CheckSquare=Low)
- Search and filter functionality (by task name/description, level, and status)
- Task statistics summary cards showing totals, completion progress
- Performance optimized with React.memo for recursive TaskNode component
- Tree structure built from flat task data using parent_task_id from metadata
- Integrated with useTaskStore and useProjectStore (using getSelectedProject selector)
- Updated App.tsx to route /workspace/tasks to TaskHierarchyTree component
- Legend section explaining level and status indicators
- Accessibility: role="tree", role="treeitem", aria-expanded, aria-selected attributes
Committed as 5518669.

phases.name: HITL Interface
phases.description: Create HITL Store, Request Card component, and Queue View

subtasks.description: Create HITL Request Store for human-in-the-loop request management
acceptance_criteria: Fetch pending requests from hitl_requests table
subtasks.notes:
Created useHITLStore.ts with Zustand following useTaskStore pattern. Features implemented:
- Added HITLRequest types to supabase.ts (HITLRequestStatus, HITLRequestType, Row/Insert/Update)
- CRUD operations: fetchRequests, fetchPendingRequests, fetchRequestById, createRequest, updateRequest, deleteRequest
- submitResponse action for approve/reject workflows with timestamp tracking
- Real-time Supabase subscriptions for project-based updates
- Helper selectors: getRequestsByStatus, getRequestsByUrgency, getPendingRequests, getRequestsSortedByUrgency
- Comprehensive test suite (20+ test cases) covering state management, request handling, subscriptions, and helper selectors

Committed as fb896db. Note: Tests could not be run locally due to sandbox command restrictions (npm commands blocked), but test file follows existing patterns from useTaskStore.test.ts.

subtasks.description: Create HITL Request Card component with urgency badge and actions
subtasks.notes: Created HITLRequestCard component with urgency badge (critical/high/medium/low levels), request type badges, approve/reject buttons with optional response input, relative timestamps, and proper state handling for pending/approved/rejected statuses.

subtasks.description: Create HITL Queue View with sorting and filtering
subtasks.notes: HITLQueue component created with full sorting (urgency/date/type) and filtering (status/type) functionality. Route added at /workspace/hitl. Component integrates with HITLRequestCard and hitlRequests mock data.

phases.name: Partner Agent Enhancement
phases.description: Add deep research capability and interview workflow to Partner Agent

subtasks.description: Add deep_research() method to Partner Agent with RAG + Web integration
acceptance_criteria: Integration with mcp-rag for RAG search
Integration with mcp-web-research for web search
subtasks.notes:
deep_research() method already implemented with RAG + Web integration. Commit b814ff6. Features implemented:
- ResearchSource and DeepResearchResult dataclasses for structured results
- RESEARCH_SYNTHESIS_PROMPT for LLM-based synthesis
- deep_research() method with parallel RAG + Web search using asyncio.gather
- _search_rag() for MCP RAG server integration (K-IFRS/K-GAAS standards)
- _search_web() for MCP Web Research server integration
- _synthesize_research() for LLM-based result synthesis
- _get_fallback_rag_results() and _get_fallback_web_results() for graceful degradation
- _build_research_context() for client context extraction
- _parse_synthesis_response() for JSON response parsing with fallback
- Comprehensive test suite in tests/unit/test_agents/test_partner_agent.py (lines 1279-1995)

subtasks.description: Create interview_node for audit strategy interview workflow
acceptance_criteria: Deep question generation for requirements extraction
subtasks.notes:
Created interview_node.py with comprehensive audit strategy interview workflow. Features implemented:
- 13 predefined checklist questions across 5 phases (client overview, business operations, risk factors, prior audit history, special considerations)
- Dynamic LLM-generated follow-up questions triggered by response keywords
- Specification document generation with structured JSON output
- HITL interrupts for user response collection and interview review approval
- Plan mode entry (next_action: "ENTER_PLAN_MODE") after interview completion
- Helper functions: get_interview_progress(), validate_interview_responses()
- Comprehensive test suite with 50+ test cases
Committed as 659ea83.

phases.name: Manager Agent Enhancement
phases.description: Add dynamic staff allocation capability to Manager Agent

subtasks.description: Add allocate_staff_agents() method for dynamic staff allocation
acceptance_criteria: Allocation based on risk level, required skills, workload
subtasks.notes:
Implemented allocate_staff_agents() method for dynamic staff allocation in Manager Agent. Features include:
- allocate_staff_agents(task, available_staff) method with comprehensive allocation logic
- Allocation based on risk level (CRITICAL/HIGH/MEDIUM/LOW), required skills, and workload
- Proportional allocation to task complexity with weighted scoring (40% skill match, 35% availability, 25% expertise)
- Load balancing across available staff with priority adjustment for high-workload staff
- Helper methods: _extract_task_requirements(), _calculate_allocation_score(), _create_balanced_allocations(), _calculate_base_priority(), _adjust_priority_for_workload(), get_required_staff_types()
- Data structures: StaffType enum, RiskLevel enum, StaffProfile dataclass, AllocationResult dataclass, TaskRequirements dataclass
- STAFF_SKILL_MAPPING and CATEGORY_SKILL_REQUIREMENTS lookup tables
- Comprehensive test suite with 50+ test cases covering all allocation logic
Committed as 1551240. Python syntax verified. Note: Full pytest verification could not be run due to missing langchain dependencies in sandbox, but code compiles correctly.

phases.name: Staff Agent System
phases.description: Create Staff Agent Factory and implement specialized staff agents with MCP integration

subtasks.description: Create Staff Agent Factory for specialized agent spawning
acceptance_criteria: Support for: Excel_Parser, Standard_Retriever, Vouching_Assistant, WorkPaper_Generator
subtasks.notes:
Created Staff Agent Factory (staff_factory.py) with:
- StaffAgentFactory class with factory pattern for agent creation
- StaffAgentType enum: EXCEL_PARSER, STANDARD_RETRIEVER, VOUCHING_ASSISTANT, WORKPAPER_GENERATOR
- create_agent() - Create agent by enum type
- get_agent() - Create agent by string identifier
- create_all_agents() - Create all 4 agent types
- create_agents_for_task() - Create subset of agents for specific task
- Caching support with clear_cache()
- Convenience functions: get_factory(), create_staff_agent()
- Comprehensive test suite (40+ tests) covering all methods and edge cases
- Updated agents/__init__.py to export factory components
Committed as 741ca96. Note: pytest verification could not be run locally due to sandbox restrictions, but Python syntax verified successfully.

subtasks.description: Implement Staff Agents with MCP tool integration
acceptance_criteria: Proper error handling for MCP failures
subtasks.notes:
Implemented Staff Agents with MCP tool integration:
- Added MCPExcelClient to mcp_client.py for Excel file parsing
- Added MCPDocumentClient to mcp_client.py for workpaper document generation
- Updated ExcelParserAgent with MCP Excel Processor integration (with fallback to mock data)
- Updated StandardRetrieverAgent already has MCP RAG integration
- VouchingAssistantAgent uses LLM for professional judgment
- Updated WorkPaperGeneratorAgent with MCP Document Generator integration (with fallback)
- All agents have proper error handling for MCP failures
- Code compiles without syntax errors (verified with py_compile)

phases.name: LangGraph Integration
phases.description: Update State Definition, Main Graph, and add HITL Interrupt nodes

subtasks.description: Update State Definition with new fields for EGA and HITL

verification.command: cd backend && python -c "from src.graph.state import AuditState; print('State import OK')"

subtasks.notes:
Updated AuditState TypedDict with new fields for EGA and HITL support:
- interview_complete: bool - tracks interview workflow completion
- interview_phase: int - current interview phase (1-5)
- interview_responses: List[Dict[str, Any]] - collected interview responses
- specification: Dict[str, Any] - generated specification document from interview
- egas: List[Dict[str, Any]] - EGAs extracted from Assigned Workflow documents
- urgency_config: Dict[str, Any] - configuration for urgency calculation (weights, hitl_threshold)

Also updated next_action comment to include "ENTER_PLAN_MODE" action.
Python syntax verified with py_compile. Committed as 6f8e48b.

subtasks.description: Update Main Graph with new nodes and conditional routing

verification.command: cd backend && python -c "from src.graph.graph import graph; print('Graph import OK')"

subtasks.notes:
Updated Main Graph with new nodes and conditional routing. Changes include:
- Added interview_node and wait_for_interview_completion_node from existing nodes
- Added placeholder imports with try/except for ega_parser_node (BE-13.1), task_generator_node (BE-13.2), urgency_node (BE-13.3), hitl_interrupt_node (BE-14.3)
- Implemented 7 conditional routing functions for workflow state management
- Updated create_parent_graph with full workflow: Interview -> Wait for Interview -> Partner Planning -> Wait for Approval -> EGA Parser -> Task Generator -> Urgency Node -> HITL Interrupt -> Manager Dispatch -> Final Aggregation
- Added get_graph() helper for lazy-loaded graph instance
- Python syntax verified with py_compile
- Committed as 809f243
Note: Full import verification could not be run due to missing langgraph dependency in sandbox, but code compiles correctly and follows existing patterns.

subtasks.description: Create HITL Interrupt Node for escalation handling
subtasks.notes:
Created HITL Interrupt Node for escalation handling (hitl_interrupt.py) with comprehensive features:

- hitl_interrupt_node: Main node for urgency-based HITL escalation (triggers on urgency_score >= threshold, default 75)
- process_individual_hitl_node: Node for processing individual HITL requests
- HITLRequestType, HITLRequestStatus, HITLUrgencyLevel enums for type safety
- Utility functions: get_hitl_summary(), should_trigger_hitl(), calculate_urgency_score()
- Uses interrupt() from langgraph.types for workflow pause
- Support for batch (approve_all, reject_all) and individual review modes
- DEFAULT_URGENCY_CONFIG with configurable thresholds and weights

Test suite: 50+ tests covering all functionality including async node tests, helper functions, edge cases.
Exported via nodes/__init__.py.

Committed as 2e9374c.

phases.name: EGA Parsing and Task Generation
phases.description: Create EGA Parser, Task Generator, and Urgency Calculation nodes

subtasks.description: Create EGA Parser Node for extracting EGAs from Assigned Workflow documents
subtasks.notes:
Created EGA Parser Node (ega_parser.py) with comprehensive EGA extraction capabilities:

- ega_parser_node: LangGraph node for parsing workflow documents from shared_documents
- parse_assigned_workflow(file_path, file_url, project_id): Core async function with MCP Excel integration
- EGA dataclass with full attribute support and to_dict() serialization
- EGARiskLevel (critical/high/medium/low) and EGAStatus (pending/in_progress/review_required/completed) enums

Key features:
- Column name normalization supporting various Excel column naming conventions
- Risk level parsing from string or numeric values with intelligent defaults
- Priority calculation from risk level or explicit value (clamped 1-100)
- Hierarchy building by category grouping (first EGA in category becomes parent)
- Metadata extraction (category, assertion, procedure, materiality, assigned_to, due_date, notes)

Utility functions:
- get_ega_summary(): Statistics for EGA lists (by risk level, status, avg priority)
- filter_egas_by_risk(): Filter by specified risk levels
- sort_egas_by_priority(): Sort descending/ascending by priority
- _generate_egas_from_plan(): Generate from audit plan when no docs uploaded
- _get_fallback_egas(): Sample EGAs for demo/testing when MCP unavailable

Graceful degradation:
- Falls back to sample EGAs when MCP Excel server unavailable
- Generates from audit_plan if no workflow documents in shared_documents
- Comprehensive error handling with EGAParseResult containing success, egas, errors, warnings

Exports added to nodes/__init__.py: ega_parser_node, parse_assigned_workflow, EGA, EGAParseResult, EGARiskLevel, EGAStatus, get_ega_summary, filter_egas_by_risk, sort_egas_by_priority

Test suite (50+ tests) in tests/test_ega_parser.py covering:
- EGA dataclass and enum tests
- Helper function tests (ID generation, column normalization, risk parsing, priority parsing)
- Extraction tests (_extract_egas_from_data, hierarchy building)
- Async tests for parse_assigned_workflow and ega_parser_node
- Edge case tests (Unicode, empty data, malformed input)
- Integration-style workflow simulation

Python syntax verified with py_compile. Committed as 795dd34.

subtasks.description: Create Task Generation Node for 3-level task hierarchy from EGAs
subtasks.notes:
Created task_generator.py with comprehensive 3-level task hierarchy generation from EGAs.

Features implemented:
- TaskLevel enum (High/Mid/Low) for hierarchy classification
- TaskStatus, RiskLevel enums for status and risk tracking
- GeneratedTask and TaskGenerationResult dataclasses
- Standard audit assertions mapping (Existence, Completeness, Valuation, Rights & Obligations, Presentation & Disclosure, Cut-off)
- Assertion-to-procedure mapping for Low-level task generation

Core Functions:
- task_generator_node: LangGraph node for state-based task generation
- generate_task_hierarchy: Main entry point for 3-level generation
- generate_high_level_task: Creates High-level tasks from EGAs
- generate_mid_level_tasks: Creates Mid-level tasks for assertions
- generate_low_level_tasks: Creates Low-level tasks for procedures
- _select_assertions_for_ega: Intelligently selects relevant assertions based on EGA category

Utility Functions:
- get_task_summary: Statistics by level, status, risk
- filter_tasks_by_level/status: Task filtering helpers
- get_task_children/get_task_tree: Hierarchy navigation
- sort_tasks_by_priority/risk_score: Task sorting helpers

Test suite: 50+ tests covering all functionality, edge cases, and Unicode handling.
Exported via nodes/__init__.py.
Python syntax verified with py_compile.
Committed as 20a617a.

Note: Full pytest verification could not be run due to sandbox restrictions, but code compiles correctly and follows existing patterns from partner.py and ega_parser.py.

subtasks.description: Create Urgency Calculation Node for task urgency scoring
acceptance_criteria: Urgency score calculation (materiality 40%, risk 35%, AI confidence 25%)
subtasks.notes:
Created urgency_node.py with comprehensive urgency calculation capabilities:

**Implementation:**
- `urgency_node`: LangGraph node for calculating task urgency scores
- `calculate_task_urgency_score`: Single task urgency calculation
- `calculate_urgency_scores`: Batch calculation for all tasks
- `UrgencyLevel` enum: critical/high/medium/low
- `UrgencyCalculationResult` and `TaskUrgencyInfo` dataclasses

**Urgency Score Formula (per spec):**
- materiality_factor * 0.40 (task amount vs overall materiality)
- risk_factor * 0.35 (task risk score 0-100)
- ai_confidence_factor * 0.25 (lower confidence = higher urgency)

**Key Features:**
- Configurable thresholds via state.urgency_config
- HITL threshold-based escalation trigger (requires_hitl flag)
- Urgency breakdown in task metadata
- Korean language support in status messages

**Utility Functions:**
- get_urgency_summary: Statistics for task urgency
- filter_tasks_by_urgency: Filter by score/level/hitl requirement
- sort_tasks_by_urgency: Sort by urgency score
- get_hitl_candidates: Get tasks requiring human review

**Test Suite:** 50+ tests covering:
- Enum and constant tests
- Dataclass tests
- Helper function tests
- Single task urgency calculation
- Batch urgency calculation
- LangGraph node tests
- Utility function tests
- Edge cases (Unicode, large lists, malformed data)

**Exports:** Added to nodes/__init__.py

Committed as 35abe31. Note: pytest verification could not be run due to sandbox restrictions, but Python syntax verified with py_compile.

phases.name: API Endpoints
phases.description: Add Project, EGA, and HITL REST API endpoints

subtasks.description: Add Project CRUD endpoints
subtasks.notes:
Implemented full Project CRUD API endpoints in backend/src/api/routes.py:

**Endpoints Added:**
- POST /api/projects: Create a new audit project (with UUID generation)
- GET /api/projects: List all projects with optional status filtering and pagination (limit/offset)
- GET /api/projects/{id}: Get project details by ID
- PUT /api/projects/{id}: Update existing project (partial updates supported)
- DELETE /api/projects/{id}: Delete project by ID

**Pydantic Models Added:**
- ProjectStatus enum (planning, in_progress, review, completed)
- CreateProjectRequest: Validation for project creation
- UpdateProjectRequest: Partial update validation
- ProjectResponse: Single project response
- ProjectListResponse: List with total count
- ProjectDetailResponse: Single project with status
- ProjectCreateResponse: Creation confirmation with message
- ProjectDeleteResponse: Deletion confirmation

**Key Features:**
- Integration with Supabase audit_projects table
- Full error handling with proper HTTP status codes (201, 200, 400, 404, 500)
- Comprehensive logging for all operations
- Helper function _convert_project_row_to_response for row conversion

Python syntax verified with py_compile. Committed as 61b6d40.

subtasks.description: Add EGA endpoints for parsing and listing
subtasks.notes:
Subtask was already completed in previous session (commit 3f9b12a). All EGA endpoints implemented in routes.py:
- GET /api/projects/{id}/egas: List EGAs with filtering by risk_level, status, sorting, pagination, and optional summary
- GET /api/projects/{id}/egas/{ega_id}: Get specific EGA details
- POST /api/projects/{id}/egas: Create EGA manually with validation
- PUT /api/projects/{id}/egas/{ega_id}: Update EGA with partial updates
- DELETE /api/projects/{id}/egas/{ega_id}: Delete EGA
- POST /api/projects/{id}/egas/parse: Parse Assigned Workflow document (supports file upload and file_url from Supabase Storage)

Pydantic models: EGAResponse, EGAListResponse, EGADetailResponse, EGAParseRequest, EGAParseResponse, CreateEGARequest, UpdateEGARequest, EGARiskLevelEnum, EGAStatusEnum

Integration with ega_parser.py for document parsing and audit_egas Supabase table for persistence.
